project.name: Satyam's gallery components
project.description: Gallery components written by Daniel Barreiro aka Satyam.

gallery-makenode.name: gallery-makenode
gallery-makenode.description: An extension for Widget to create markup from templates, create CSS classNames, locating elements, assist in attaching events to UI elements and to reflect attribute changes into the UI. All of its members are either protected or private. Developers using MakeNode should use only those marked protected. Enable the Show Protected checkbox to see them.

gallery-md-accordion.name: gallery-md-accordion
gallery-md-accordion.description: The accordion module creates a control with titles and expandable sections for each

gallery-md-button-group.name: gallery-md-button-group
gallery-md-button-group.description:
Provides a container to group buttons.
It can hold instances of Y.Button, Y.ButtonToggle or Y.ButtonSeparator.

gallery-md-ibutton.name: gallery-md-ibutton
gallery-md-ibutton.description: Provides an iPhone-style toggle button (checkbox) object

gallery-md-spinner.name: gallery-md-spinner
gallery-md-spinner.description: Shows an input box with a set of up/down buttons to change its value.

gallery-md-timespinner.name: gallery-md-timespinner
gallery-md-timespinner.description:
Shows and accepts a time via a set of spinners.  
It can run showing the current time.

timeline.name: timeline
timeline.description: Shows in the browser timeline files produced by the program from The Timeline Project.

gallery-stdmod.name: gallery-stdmod
gallery-stdmod.description:
A version of Widget-StdMod that uses the ContentBox of the Widget as its Body section and adds the Header and Footer sections on each side of it instead of having the three of them under the contentBox. This turns quite handy when used along WidgetParent since the later assumes children will be added in the contentBox and thus conflicts with the StdMod sections. (this can also be solved using the property _childrenContainer)

For further documentation see WidgetStdMod

MakeNode.name: MakeNode
MakeNode.description: An extension for Widget to create markup from templates, create CSS classNames, locating elements, assist in attaching events to UI elements and to reflect attribute changes into the UI. All of its members are either protected or private. Developers using MakeNode should use only those marked protected. Enable the Show Protected checkbox to see them.

AccordionPanel.name: AccordionPanel
AccordionPanel.description: The AccordionPanel class represents one of the panels within an accordion

params.name: cfg
params.description: (optional) configuration attributes

Accordion.name: Accordion
Accordion.description: A collection of vertically aligned collapsible panels

Button.name: Button
Button.description: The Button class provides a fancier type of button.

params.name: cfg
params.description: Configuration Attributes

ButtonToggle.name: ButtonToggle
ButtonToggle.description: The ButtonToggle class provides a two-state button

params.name: cfg
params.description: Configuration attributes

ButtonSeparator.name: ButtonSeparator
ButtonSeparator.description: The ButtonSeparator class provides a passive divider to use in between groups of buttons

ButtonGroup.name: ButtonGroup
ButtonGroup.description:
The ButtonGroup class provides a container for sets of Buttons.
All buttons added will be extended with Y.WidgetChild.

params.name: cfg
params.description: Configuration attributes

IButton.name: IButton
IButton.description: The IButton class provides an IPhone style of sliding on/off button

params.name: cfg
params.description: Configuration Attributes

Spinner.name: Spinner
Spinner.description: Shows an input box with a set of up/down buttons to change its value.

TimeSpinner.name: TimeSpinner
TimeSpinner.description: The TimeSpinner shows a set of spinners for hour, minute and optionally seconds and AM/PM.

params.name: cfg
params.description: (optional) configuration attributes

Y.Timeline.name: Y.Timeline
Y.Timeline.description: Displays within a given container a timeline file from the given URL

params.name: config
params.description: configuration options

StdMod.name: StdMod
StdMod.description:
A version of Widget-StdMod that uses the ContentBox of the Widget as its Body section and adds the Header and Footer sections on each side of it instead of having the three of them under the contentBox. This turns quite handy when used along WidgetParent since the later assumes children will be added in the contentBox and thus conflicts with the StdMod sections. (this can also be solved using the property _childrenContainer)

For further documentation see WidgetStdMod

classitems.description: Creates CSS classNames from suffixes listed in _CLASS_NAMES, stores them in this._classNames. Concatenates _ATTRS_2_UI into _UI_ATTRS. Sets listeners to render and destroy events to attach/detach UI events. If there is no renderUI defined in this class or any of its ancestors (not counting Widget which has a dummy one) it will add a default one appending the result of processing _TEMPLATE and then call _locateNodes.
Method to be used if no explicit renderUI method is defined.
classitems.name: _autoRenderUI

classitems.description:
An array of event handles returned when attaching listeners to events,
meant to detach them all when destroying the instance.
classitems.name: _eventHandles

classitems.description:
Contains a hash of CSS classNames generated from the entries in _CLASS_NAMES indexed by those same values. It will also have the following entries added automatically:
  • boundingBox The className for the boundingBox
  • content The className for the contentBox
  • HEADER The className for the header section of a StdMod if Y.WidgetStdMod has been loaded
  • BODY The className for the body section of a StdMod if Y.WidgetStdMod has been loaded
  • FOOTER The className for the footer section of a StdMod if Y.WidgetStdMod has been loaded
classitems.name: _classNames

classitems.description:
Hash listing the template processing codes and the functions to handle each.
The processing functions will receive a string with the arguments that follow the processing code,
and the extra, second argument passed on to _makeNode (or _substitute)
and should return the replacement value for the placeholder.
classitems.name: _templateHandlers

classitems.description: Parses the arguments received by the processor of the {m} placeholder. It recognizes numbers, true, false, null and double quoted strings, each separated by whitespace. It skips over anything else.
classitems.name: _parseMakeNodeArgs

params.name: arg
params.description: String to be parsed for arguments

return.description: Array of arguments found, each converted to its proper data type

classitems.description:
Enumerates all the values and keys of a given static properties for all classes in the hierarchy, 
starting with the oldest ancestor (Base).
classitems.name: _forAllXinClasses

params.name: x
params.description: name of the static property to be enumerated

params.name: fn
params.description:
function to be called for each value.  
The function will receive a reference to the class where it occurs, the value of the property 
and the key or index.

classitems.description: Processes the template given and returns a Y.Node instance.
classitems.name: _makeNode

params.name: template
params.description: (optional) Template to process. If missing, it will use the first static _TEMPLATE property found in the inheritance chain.

params.name: extras
params.description: (optional) Hash of extra values to replace into the template, beyond MakeNode's processing codes.

return.description: Instance of Y.Node produced from the template

classitems.description: Processes the given template and returns a string
classitems.name: _substitute

params.name: template
params.description: Template to process.

params.name: extras
params.description: (optional) Hash of extra values to replace into the template, beyond MakeNode's processing codes.

classitems.description: Locates the nodes with the CSS classNames listed in the this._classNames property, or those specifically requested in its arguments and stores references to them in properties named after each className key, prefixed with an underscore and followed by "Node". If the className key contains a hyphen followed by a lowercase letter, the hyphen will be dropped and the letter capitalized. Any other characters invalid for identifiers will be turned into underscores, thus for the no-label-1 className key a _noLabel_1Node property will be created.
classitems.name: _locateNodes

params.name: arg1,....
params.description: (optional) If given, list of className keys of the nodes to be located. If missing, all the classNames stored in this._classNames will be located.

classitems.description: Looks for static properties called _CLASS_NAMES in each of the classes of the inheritance chain and generates CSS classNames based on the _cssPrefix of each class and each of the suffixes listed in each them. The classNames generated will be stored in this._classNames indexed by the suffix. It will also store the classNames of the boundingBox ( boundingBox )and the contentBox ( content ). If the WidgetStdMod is used, it will also add the classNames for the three sections ( HEADER, BODY, FOOTER )
classitems.name: _makeClassNames

classitems.description: Concatenates the entries of the _ATTRS_2_UI static property of each class in the inheritance chain into this instance _UI_ATTRS property for the benefit or Widget. See Widget._UI_ATTRS
classitems.name: _concatUIAttrs

classitems.description: Attaches the events listed in the _EVENTS static property of each class in the inheritance chain.
classitems.name: _attachEvents

classitems.description:
Publishes the events listed in the _PUBLISH static property of each of the classes in the inheritance chain.
If an event has been publishes, the properties set in the descendants will override those in the original publisher.
classitems.name: _publishEvents

classitems.description: Detaches all the events created by _attachEvents
classitems.name: _detachEvents

classitems.description:
** This is a documentation entry only. This property is not defined in this file, it can be defined by the developer. **

Holds the default template to be used by _makeNode when none is explicitly provided.
The string should contain HTML code with placeholders made of a set of curly braces enclosing an initial processing code and arguments. Placeholders can be nested, any of the arguments in a placeholder can be another placeholder.
The template may also contain regular placeholders as used by Y.substitute, whose values will be extracted from the second argument to _makeNode. The processing codes are:
  • {@ attributeName} configuration attribute values
  • {p propertyName} instance property values
  • {m methodName arg1 arg2 ....} return value from instance method. The m code should be followed by the method name and any number of arguments. The placeholder is replaced by the return value or the named method.
  • {c classNameKey} CSS className generated from the _CLASS_NAMES static property
  • {s key} string from the strings attribute, using key as the sub-attribute.
  • {? arg1 arg2 arg3} If arg1 evaluates to true it returns arg2 otherwise arg3. Argument arg1 is usually a nested placeholder.
  • {1 arg1 arg2 arg3} If arg1 is 1 it returns arg2 otherwise arg3. Used to produce singular/plural text. Argument arg1 is usually a nested placeholder.
  • {n p1 arg1 .... pn argn} It will read the value resulting from the processing code p1 with argument arg1 and use that as the object to process the following processing code. It takes any number of processing codes and arguments. It only works with processing codes that take simple identifiers as arguments, ie.: not {m}.
  • {} any other value will be handled just like Y.substitute does.
For placeholders containing several arguments they must be separated by white spaces. Strings must be enclosed in double quotes, no single quotes allowed. The backslash is the escape character within strings. Numbers, null, true and false will be recognized and converted to their native values. Any argument can be a further placeholder, enclosed in its own set of curly braces.
classitems.name: _TEMPLATE

classitems.description:
** This is a documentation entry only. This property is not defined in this file, it can be defined by the developer. **

Holds an array of strings, each the suffix used to define a CSS className using the _cssPrefix of each class. The names listed here are used as the keys into this._classNames, as the argument to the {c} template placeholder and as keys for the entries in the _EVENTS property. They are also used by _locateNodes to create the private properties that hold references to the nodes created.
classitems.name: _CLASS_NAMES

classitems.description:
** This is a documentation entry only. This property is not defined in this file, it can be defined by the developer. **

Lists the attributes whose value should be reflected in the UI. It contains an object with two properties, BIND and SYNC, each containing the name of an attribute or an array of names of attributes. Those listed in BIND will have listeners attached to their change event so every such change is refreshed in the UI. Those listed in SYNC will be refreshed when the UI is rendered. For each entry in either list there should be a method named using the _uiSet prefix, followed by the name of the attribute, with its first character in uppercase. This function will receive the value to be set and the source of the change.
classitems.name: _ATTRS_2_UI

classitems.description:
** This is a documentation entry only. This property is not defined in this file, it can be defined by the developer. **

Contains a hash of elements to attach event listeners to. Each element is identified by the suffix of its generated className, as declared in the _CLASS_NAMES property.
There are seveal virtual element identifiers,
  • "boundingBox" identifies the boundingBox of the Widget
  • "content" its contextBox
  • "document" identifies the document where the component is in
  • "THIS" identifies this instance
  • "Y" identifies the YUI instance of the sandbox
If the Y.WidgetStdMod extension is used the "HEADER", "BODY" and "FOOTER" identifiers will also be available.
Each entry contains a type of event to be listened to or an array of events. Each event can be described by its type (i.e.: "key", "mousedown", etc). MakeNode will set 'after' event listeners by default, but can be instructed to listen to 'before' ('on') events or do it by delegation on the boundingBox. MakeNode will associate this event with a method named "_after","_before" or "_delegate" followed by the element identifier with the first character capitalized and the type of event with the first character capitalized (i.e.: _afterBoundingBoxClick, _afterInputBlur, _afterThisValueChange, _beforeFormSubmit, _delegateListItemClick, etc.).
Alternatively, the event listener can be described by an object literal containing properties:
  • type (mandatory) the type of event being listened to
  • fn the name of the method to handle the event. Since _EVENTS is static, it has no access to this so the name of the method must be specified
  • args extra arguments to be passed to the listener, useful, for example as a key descriptor for key events.
  • when either 'before', 'after' or 'delegate'. MakeNode defaults to set 'after' event listeners but can be told to set 'before' ('on') listeners or to delegate on the BoundingBox the capture of events on inner elements. Only className keys can be used with 'delegate'.
_EVENTS: {
    boundingBox: [
         {
              type: 'key',
              fn:'_onDirectionKey',   // calls this._onDirectionKey
              args:((!Y.UA.opera) ? "down:" : "press:") + "38, 40, 33, 34"
         },
         'mousedown'          // calls this._afterBoundingBoxMousedown
    ],
    document: 'mouseup',     // calls this._afterDocumentMouseup
    input: 'change',          // calls this._afterInputChange
    form: {type: 'submit', when:'before'}      // calls this._beforeFormSubmit
},
classitems.name: _EVENTS

classitems.description:
** This is a documentation entry only. This property is not defined in this file, it can be defined by the developer. **

Contains a hash of events to be published. Each element has the name of the event as its key and the configuration object as its value. If the event has already been published, the configuration of the event will be modified by the configuration set in the new definition. When setting functions use the name of the function, not a function reference.
classitems.name: _PUBLISH

classitems.description:
With the accordion panel container filled with with WidgetStdMod divs
it seems like too much to have a separate contentBox
classitems.name: CONTENT_TEMPLATE

classitems.description:
This is an override of WidgetStdMod method to prevent it from re-rendering the 
three sections again and again and wiping out the resize handles
classitems.name: _syncUIStdMod

classitems.description:
Adds the resizer to the body of the three section StdMod
and creates a container for the actual content within
classitems.name: renderUI

classitems.description: Listener for the after Expanded change event, toggles the panel
classitems.name: _afterExpanded

classitems.description: Expands this panel
classitems.name: expand

uses target to make sure it is the 
header of this accordion and not that of a nested one

classitems.description: Convenience method to close this panel. Called when the close icon, if present, is clicked. It fires the panelClose event to signal the container for it to remove the panel from the accordion.
classitems.name: close

classitems.description:
Fired by the panel to signal the accordion to remove this panel.
Closure of the panel can be prevented by listening and halting this event.
classitems.name: panelClose

classitems.description: Defines the class names used by MakeNode, later stored in this._classNames.
classitems.name: _CLASS_NAMES

classitems.description: Defines the template used by MakeNode to build the container for the body
classitems.name: _TEMPLATE

classitems.description: Defines the template used by MakeNode to build the container for the header
classitems.name: _HEADER_TEMPLATE

classitems.description:
Defines the UI events to be attached through MakeNode,
specifically, click on the headers
classitems.name: _EVENTS

classitems.description: Defines the attributes that MakeNode should link to _uiSetXxxx methods to reflect them in the UI.
classitems.name: _ATTRS_2_UI

classitems.description: State of this panel
classitems.name: expanded

classitems.description: Text to be shown in the header of this accordion panel
classitems.name: label

classitems.description: Content to be shown in the body of this accordion panel
classitems.name: content

classitems.description:
Allows panels to be resized.
Requires the optional resize-plugin module to be loaded.
classitems.name: resizeable

classitems.description:
Allows panels to be closed via an icon in the header.
It shows or hides the close icon.  
Panels can be closedvia programming at any time, regardless of this attribute.
classitems.name: closeable

Event listener for child expansion/collapse, ensures that only one is expanded
at a time if multiExpand is not set.

classitems.description: Sets the resizeable attribute of all panels to the value set for the whole accordion

classitems.description: Sets the closeable attribute of all panels to the value set for the whole accordion
classitems.name: _uiSetCloseable

params.name: value
params.description: new value of the closeable attribute

classitems.description: Defines the attributes that MakeNode should link to _uiSetXxxx methods to reflect them in the UI.

classitems.description:
Defines events that are to be associated to listeners by MakeNode.
Here it links a couple of events from the items,
expandedChange to ensure only one panel is open at a time and
panelClose to destroy and remove a panel
classitems.name: _EVENTS

classitems.description: Default type of children to create.  Used by WidgetParent.

classitems.name: multiExpand

classitems.description:

classitems.description:
Renders the HTML elements of this component.  
Uses the TEMPLATE static variable to produce the markup.
Calls _locateNodes to get the references to the elements created.
classitems.name: renderUI

classitems.description:
Bounding box mouse down handler. Will determine if the mouse down
is on one of the spinner buttons, and increment/decrement the value
accordingly.

The method also sets up a timer, to support the user holding the mouse
down on the spinner buttons. The timer is cleared when a mouse up event
is detected.
classitems.name: _afterBoundingBoxMousedown

params.name: ev
params.description: Event facade produced by the event handler

classitems.description:
Override the default content box value, since we don't want the srcNode
to be the content box for spinner.
classitems.name: _defaultCB

classitems.description:
Document mouse up handler. Clears the timers supporting
the "mouse held down" behavior.
classitems.name: _afterDocumentMouseup

classitems.description:
Bounding box Arrow up/down, Page up/down key listener.

Increments/Decrement the spinner value, based on the key pressed.
classitems.name: _onDirectionKey

params.name: ev
params.description: as provided by the key listener

classitems.description:
Simple change handler, to make sure user does not input an invalid value.
If an error is detected, focus will return to the input box and the input box highlighted briefly.
classitems.name: _afterInputChange

classitems.description: Default parser for the user input.  It assumes only integers are expected
classitems.name: parser

params.name: value
params.description: value read from the input box

classitems.description: Formats the internal value to be shown to the user
classitems.name: formatter

params.name: value
params.description: value to be shown

classitems.description:
Initiates mouse down timers, to increment slider, while mouse button
is held down
classitems.name: _setMouseDownTimers

params.name: dir
params.description: Direction, up or down, to change at each tick

params.name: step
params.description: Amount to change on each tick

classitems.description: If attribute wraparound is true this method is set as a before listener for the valueChange event. When one end of the range is reached, it will make it jump to the other end. Changes the newVal property of the event facade, which will be the new value for the attribute. If stepping by more than one, it will advance the value by the remaining amount of the step. Fires the wrapped event when the value is wrapped around.
classitems.name: _wrap

classitems.description: Fires when one end of the range is reached and the value is folded to the other end.
classitems.name: wrapped

params.name: prevVal
params.description: value that triggered the wrapping

params.name: newVal
params.description: new value after wrapping

classitems.description: Clears timers used to support the "mouse held down" behavior
classitems.name: _clearMouseDownTimers

classitems.description: Updates the value of the input box to reflect the value passed in through the value configuration attribute
classitems.name: _uiSetValue

params.name: value
params.description: new value to be set

params.name: src
params.description: source of the new value.  If the source is 'ui' the change will be ignored.

classitems.description: Attaches the _wrap method as a before-event listener when wraparound is set.
classitems.name: _uiSetWraparound

params.name: value
params.description: value of wraparound attribute

classitems.description:
value attribute default validator. Verifies that
the value being set lies between the min/max value
classitems.name: _validateValue

params.name: val
params.description: value to be validated

classitems.description: MakeNode template for this component
classitems.name: _TEMPLATE

classitems.description: List of CSS class name suffixes to be generated and used in the template
classitems.name: _CLASS_NAMES

classitems.description: Descriptor of DOM events to be listened to and the methods to handle them
classitems.name: _EVENTS

classitems.description: The minimum value for the spinner.
classitems.name: min

classitems.description: The maximum value for the spinner.
classitems.name: min

classitems.description: The current value of the spinner.
classitems.name: value

classitems.description: Amount to increment/decrement the spinner when the buttons or arrow up/down keys are pressed.
classitems.name: minorStep

classitems.description: Amount to increment/decrement the spinner when the page up/down keys are pressed.
classitems.name: majorStep

classitems.description: override default ("null"), required for focus()
classitems.name: tabIndex

classitems.description: The strings for the spinner UI (used in the tooltip texts)
classitems.name: strings

classitems.description: Function to format the value to be shown to the user
classitems.name: formatter

classitems.description: Function to format the value entered by the user
classitems.name: parser

classitems.description: Whether the values should wrap around to the other end when one end of the range is reached
classitems.name: wraparound

classitems.description: Adds the value attribute to the list of attributes whose change needs to be reflected in the UI
classitems.name: _ATTRS_2_UI

classitems.description: Tells Widget to read the value from the input box if any existing markup is found
classitems.name: HTML_PASER

classitems.description: Reference to the Spinner showing the hours.
classitems.name: _hourSp

classitems.description: Reference to the Spinner showing the minutes.
classitems.name: _minSp

classitems.description: Reference to the Spinner showing the seconds.
classitems.name: _secSp

classitems.description: Reference to the Spinner showingam/pm.
classitems.name: _ampmSp

classitems.description: Reference to the timer created by Y.later that updates the time.
classitems.name: _timer

classitems.description:
Difference in milliseconds in between the current time and that displayed.  
Used when the timer is running to display times other than the current time.
classitems.name: _offset

classitems.description: Helper factory to make a single Spinner
classitems.name: _spFact

params.name: which
params.description: ClassName key for the spinner and strings subkey for its title

params.name: cfg
params.description: (optional) configuration attribute overrides

params.name: where
params.description: (optional) where to render it

classitems.description:
Renders the hours and minutes spinners. 
The other two, being optional, are rendered when set.
classitems.name: renderUI

classitems.description: Sets the listeners for events from the hours and minutes spinners.
classitems.name: bindUI

classitems.description: Creates or destroys the seconds spinner and attaches/detaches the event listeners.
classitems.name: _uiSetSeconds

params.name: value
params.description: whether to show the seconds spinner or not

classitems.description: Creates or destroys the am/pm spinner and attaches/detaches the event listeners.
classitems.name: _uiSetAmpm

params.name: value
params.description: whether to show the am/pm spinner or not

classitems.description: Shows the current value in the set of spinners
classitems.name: _uiSetValue

params.name: value
params.description: value to be shown

params.name: src
params.description:
source of the change in value.  
       If src===UI, the value comes from the spinners, it needs not be refreshed

classitems.description: Sets the interval for refreshing the display
classitems.name: _uiSetInterval

params.name: value
params.description: milliseconds in between refreshes

classitems.description: Sets the timer running.
classitems.name: _uiSetRunning

params.name: value
params.description: run or not

classitems.description: Listener for a change in any of the spinners, sets the value.
classitems.name: _afterValueChange

classitems.description:
Listener for the wrapped event of the spinners to propagate 
the changes from seconds to minutes and minutes to hours.

params.name: ev
params.description: to find out which one wrapped and which way

classitems.description: Callback for the interval timer to update the time shown
classitems.name: _updateTime

classitems.description:
Getter for the time value.  It returns the current time minus the offset 
or the time when it was stopped.
classitems.name: _getTime

classitems.description:
Setter for the time value.  
It calculates and saves the offset in between the current time and that set.
classitems.name: _setTime

params.name: value
params.description: time to be shown

classitems.description: Helper method to set the timer running. Same as this.set('running', true);
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: Helper method to stop the timer. Same as this.set('running', false);
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description: Whether to show the am/pm indicator or show a 24 hours timer.
classitems.name: showAmPm

classitems.description: Whether to show the seconds indicator
classitems.name: showSeconds

classitems.description: Value of the timer
classitems.name: value
classitems.default: time at initialization or current time if running

classitems.description: How often to refresh the time displayed
classitems.name: interval

classitems.description: Whether the timer is running.
classitems.name: running

classitems.description: Set of localizable strings to be used as tooltips on the spinners.
classitems.name: strings

classitems.description: Sets up listeners to respond to setting the URL,the CONTAINER or to the arrival of the timeline file.
classitems.name: initializer

params.name: cfg
params.description: configuration attributes

classitems.description: Returns the boolean value of a given tag in an XML document
classitems.name: _readBoolean

params.name: xml
params.description: The XML document or fragment to parse

params.name: tag
params.description: The tag for the value sought

return.description: the value read or null if not found

classitems.description: Returns and parses a date from a given tag in an XML document
classitems.name: _readDate

params.name: xml
params.description: The XML document or fragment to parse

params.name: tag
params.description: The tag for the value sought

return.description: the value read or null if not found

classitems.description: Returns and parses a color value from a given tag in an XML document
classitems.name: _readColor

params.name: xml
params.description: The XML document or fragment to parse

params.name: tag
params.description: The tag for the value sought

return.description: the RGB value as #rrggbb read or null if not found

classitems.description: Returns the textual contents from a given tag in an XML document
classitems.name: _readValue

params.name: xml
params.description: The XML document or fragment to parse

params.name: tag
params.description: The tag for the value sought

return.description: the content read or null if not found

classitems.description: Returns the XML element from given tag in an XML document
classitems.name: _readEl

params.name: xml
params.description: The XML document or fragment to parse

params.name: tag
params.description: The tag for the value sought

return.description: the element read or null if not found

classitems.description: Reads the categories information
classitems.name: _xmlReadCategories

params.name: cats
params.description: collection of categories

classitems.description: Reads the view information
classitems.name: _xmlReadView

params.name: view
params.description: view information

classitems.description: Reads the events to show
classitems.name: _xmlReadEvents

params.name: cats
params.description: collection of events

classitems.description: Sugar method to set the URL of the timeline file
classitems.name: load

params.name: url
params.description: URL of the timeline file

classitems.description:
Requests the timeline information from the configured URL and parses it when it arrives.
Signals its arrival by setting the 'loaded' configuration attribute
classitems.name: _load

classitems.description: Adjusts the region information for the given node to make it relative to the container position
classitems.name: _getRegion

params.name: node
params.description: node to find the region

return.description: region of the node relative to the container

classitems.description: Draws the bars corresponding to the events in the container
classitems.name: _resize

params.name: container
params.description: optional, the container for the bars.  It reads the container attribute if none given

classitems.description:
Locates the bars so that they don't overlap one another.  Range events are drawn above the middle line,
point events below.  Range events may be moved below if the start and end dates are indistinguishable
classitems.name: _locate

classitems.description:
Draws the grid, adjusting the interval in between lines from an hour to ten thousand years
depending on the zoom factor
classitems.name: _grid

classitems.description: Sugar method to set the container attribute.
classitems.name: render

params.name: container
params.description: CSS selector or reference to the container node.

classitems.description: Renders the timeline in response to the container being set and the timeline file loaded
classitems.name: _render

classitems.description: Hides de extended description
classitems.name: _hideDescr

classitems.description: Shows the extended description above the event bar clicked
classitems.name: _showDescr

params.name: ev
params.description: to help locate the bar clicked

classitems.description: Saves the initial position of a drag and the initial values of the start and end dates
classitems.name: _startMove

params.name: ev
params.description: information about the cursor at the start

classitems.description:
Respondes to the movement of the cursor at whatever rate the system sends the signal
by updating the start and end times of the display, either panning or zooming
classitems.name: _dragMove

params.name: ev
params.description: event information, specially cursor coordinates and state of the control key

classitems.description: Listener for the mouse wheel change.  It will zoom or pan depending on the state of the control key.
classitems.name: _mouseWheel

params.name: ev
params.description: the state of the control key and the direction of the mouse wheel roll is extracted from it

classitems.description: Stores the categories, indexed by category name.
classitems.name: categories

classitems.description: Array of the names of the categories hidden
classitems.name: hiddenCats

classitems.description: Start time (left edge) of the current timeline, in miliseconds
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: End time (right edge) of the current timeline, in miliseconds
classitems.name: end

classitems.description: A reference to the HTML for rendering the timeline
classitems.name: container
classitems.type: {String | Y.Node}  A reference to a node or a CSS selector.  It will always be returned as a Node reference

classitems.description: URL of the timeline file to be displayed
classitems.name: url

classitems.description: Signals whether the timeline file has been loaded or not
classitems.name: loaded

classitems.description: Localizable strings meant to be seen by the user
classitems.name: strings
